title: (x) "A Band Apart" geometric sans caps - Busorama {Norbert}
content:
Anybody? I'm sorry I couldn't get a picture with a higher resolution, but I can enlarge it in a photo editing program if you wish, albeit with some major blur.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [abandapart.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019151154/http:/typophile.com/files/abandapart.jpg) | 2.75 KB |
author: Pico

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019151154im_/http:/typophile.com/files/busorama_1_6076.png)
  
 [Busorama](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019151154/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=busorama). Why it's called URW and not _ITC_ Busorama baffles me!?

Hmmmm...

The ITC version displays the curved crossbar on cap "T" and the sample you show has a straight T as offered in URW verstion... plus cap "A" curve right. The original ITC Busorama had plenty of alternates, not sure if either digital version does.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019151154im_/http:/typophile.com/files/busorama_ITC_4784.png)
